_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Mill Creek Station complies with the rules and regulations governing the storage and handling of the covered material. Inspections, maintenance and employee training are important components of our accident prevention program.

1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies: The owners, management, and employees of Mill Creek Station are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia by utilization of proper equipment, regular inspections and maintenance and training of all persons that work with the materials. Should an accidental release occur, the facility has orientated the local fire department and the local emergency planning committee so they can plan for response to any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment. The facility also has an Emergency Response Plan that addresses response to incidents and evacuation.

2. Facility and the Regulated Substances Handled: The primary activity at Mill Creek Station is producing electricity from coal. Anhydrous ammonia is received by truck, stored, and used in the selective catalytic reduction system.

3. General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps: Mill Creek Station has implemented Process Safety Management and Risk Management Plan Prevention Programs to manage the use of its anhydrous ammonia. These programs cover employee participation, process hazard analyses, training, standard operating procedures, mechanical

integrity, emergency response, compliance audits, hot work and other safe work practices, process safety information, management of change, prestart-up safety reviews, incident investigations, and trade secrets.

4. Five-year Accident History: There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia at this facility in the past 5 years.

5. Emergency Response Program: The facility has a written Emergency Response Plan in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.120 and provides stat

e and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III of EPCRA.

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety: Safety improvements are an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe practices and operations. Mill Creek Station has and will continue to coordinate response activities with emergency responders including drills.
